result.execSummary:
The defendant Giovanni C Bernstorff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $250.00 fine plus costs, and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 
-----------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
-----------------

No contact with the co-actor or victim without victim and Agent's consent. Do not possess or consume medication without a valid prescription. No possession or consumption of alcohol. No possession or consumption of illegal drugs. No possession of illegal drugs.
-----------------

Comply with any counseling as recommended by the probation agent.
-----------------

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Giovanni C Bernstorff

records.addlTxt: Letters from DCC Records staff to Court regarding sentence structure

Defendant Giovanni C Bernstorff in court.  Attorney Melissa Anne Frost in court for Giovanni C Bernstorff.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA JJ Crawford. Called @ 3:34 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for change of plea as to both files - 21CF644 & 22CF245. Record by Atty. Frost as to the agreement of the parties. State has complied with the victim's rights. Victim is not present and there is no restitution request form. 
Court goes over maximum penalties, deportation, and elements. Defendant responds to court's questions as to plea questionnaire. Atty. responds to court's questions as to plea. and stipulation to facts in complaints. 

Defendant pleads:
GUILTY #2 & #3 IN 21CF644
GUILTY #2 & #3 in 22CF245
Remaining counts are dismissed and read-in. 
Court finds pleas to be knowing, voluntary, and intelligent, and finds the defendant guilty. 
Defendant does not make a statement to the Court. 
Court adopts the agreement of the parties - **SEE ATTACHED PLEA AGREEMENT**
Parties have nothing further. Court in recess.

Defendant Giovanni C Bernstorff in court.  Attorney Kathryn Keizer for Melissa Anne Frost in court for Giovanni C Bernstorff.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Court in session at 3:35 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for 4th status on 21CF644 and 1st status on 22CF245. Record by Atty. Keizer as to status and offer received. Requests plea and sentencing date about 45 days out. Court sets files as requested. Court in recess.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Giovanni C Bernstorff in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by DA Wiedenfeld.  Attorney Melissa Anne Frost in court for Giovanni C Bernstorff. Called @ 3:07 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for initial appearance on 22CF245 and status on 21CF644. Record by Atty. Frost that the defendant wishes to waive his preliminary hearing as to new file. Court goes over waiver with the defendant who responds to Court's questions. Court finds waiver to be free, knowing, intelligent and binds the defendant over for trial. Discussion as to information. Record by the State that information is not yet filed but will reflect same charges. Response by Atty. Frost who is ready to proceed to arraignment, enters not guilty pleas on behalf of defendant, and requests status about 60 days out. Court sets both matters as requested.
Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 131791,
Payable Number: 263942,
Receipt Number: 22R 008549,
Amount: $20.00
Signed bond filed with the court.

DEFENDANT MUST POST $1,000 CASH

BOND TO COVER 22GF389 & 21CF644

DEFENDANT MUST POST $500.00 CASH. (POSTED 11-24-2021)
  Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S):  NO CONTACT WITH CO-ACTOR ANDREW COBB. NO CONTACT WITH VICTIM S.L.S. dob 4-22-1967 OR RESIDENCE.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Giovanni A Bernstorff in court, in custody by video. Vivien TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared for Bond purposes only. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
